class.name: AppleURL
class.description: When working with Apple APIs, some of those APIs either return URLs or expect URLs, in particular this type is being exposed because Apple can return a URL when accessing files outside of your application sandbox, and you must call the [method start_accessing_security_scoped_resource] to begin accessing the resource and when you are done, you must call [method stop_accessing_security_scoped_resource].

method.name: get_data
method.description: Loads the contents of a file referenced by the URL and returns it as a PackedByteArray.

method.name: get_path
method.description: Returns the URL contents, without percent-encoding.

method.name: get_path_encoded
method.description: Returns the URL contents, with percent-encoding.

method.name: get_string
method.description: Fetches the contents of a file URL and returns it as a string.

method.name: set_from_filepath
method.description: Sets the content of the URL from a string that represents a file path.

method.name: set_value
method.description: Sets the content of the URL from a string, it will return false if the URL can not be parsed.

method.name: start_accessing_security_scoped_resource
method.description:
In an app that has adopted App Sandbox, makes the resource pointed to by a security-scoped URL available to the app.
If this call succeeds, you can access the resource, and when you are done, you must call [method stop_accessing_security_scoped_resource].

method.name: stop_accessing_security_scoped_resource
method.description: In an app that adopts App Sandbox, revokes access to the resource pointed to by a security-scoped URL.
